faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.description: Everything you need to know about SVG to ICO conversion and favicon creation

q1.question: What is an ICO file?
q1.answer: ICO is a file format for computer icons in Microsoft Windows. ICO files contain one or more small images at multiple sizes and color depths, allowing for proper scaling.

q2.question: What's the difference between SVG to ICO and SVG to favicon?
q2.answer: SVG to favicon specifically creates web-optimized icons for websites, while SVG to ICO creates general-purpose icon files. Our converter handles both formats perfectly.

q3.question: Can I convert PNG to ICO or JPG to ICO?
q3.answer: Yes! Our multi-format ICO converter supports PNG to ICO, JPG to ICO, and many other image formats. Simply upload your image and convert to ICO format.

q4.question: What SVG features are supported?
q4.answer: Our converter supports most SVG features including paths, shapes, gradients, and text. Complex animations and interactive elements may not be preserved.

q5.question: Is my data secure?
q5.answer: Yes! All conversion happens in your browser. Your files never leave your device, ensuring complete privacy and security.

q6.question: What sizes should I choose for ICO conversion?
q6.answer: For general use, we recommend the multi-size option (16x16, 32x32, 48x48) which covers most common applications and display scenarios.

q7.question: How do I use the converted ICO files?
q7.answer: ICO files can be used as application icons, website favicons, or desktop shortcuts. They're compatible with Windows applications and web browsers.

q8.question: What's the best format to convert to ICO?
q8.answer: SVG files are ideal for ICO conversion as they maintain quality at all sizes. However, our image to ICO converter works well with PNG, JPG, and other formats too.

q9.question: How do I convert PNG to ICO?
q9.answer: Converting PNG to ICO is simple! Just upload your PNG file using our converter, choose your preferred settings (size, quality, background), and click convert. PNG files work great for ICO conversion, especially for images with transparency.

q10.question: Can I convert JPG to ICO format?
q10.answer: Yes! Our converter fully supports JPG to ICO conversion. Upload your JPG image, select your desired ICO sizes and quality settings, then download your converted ICO file. Perfect for converting photos or graphics to icon format.

q11.question: What's the difference between PNG to ICO and JPG to ICO conversion?
q11.answer: PNG to ICO preserves transparency and works best for logos and graphics with transparent backgrounds. JPG to ICO is ideal for photographic content but doesn't support transparency. Both formats convert excellently to ICO using our tool.

q12.question: What's the maximum file size I can convert?
q12.answer: Our converter supports files up to 10MB in size. This limit ensures fast processing while accommodating most image files. For larger files, consider compressing your image first or using a smaller resolution version for optimal conversion speed.

q13.question: Can I convert multiple files at once (batch conversion)?
q13.answer: Currently, our converter processes one file at a time to ensure optimal quality and performance. However, you can quickly convert multiple files by repeating the simple 3-step process for each image. We're working on batch conversion features for future updates.

q14.question: Does the converter work on mobile devices?
q14.answer: Yes! Our ICO converter is fully responsive and works perfectly on smartphones and tablets. The interface adapts to your screen size, making it easy to upload, convert, and download ICO files on any device with a modern web browser.

q15.question: What should I do if my converted ICO file doesn't look right?
q15.answer: If your ICO file appears blurry or distorted, try these solutions: 1) Use a higher quality setting during conversion, 2) Ensure your source image has sufficient resolution (at least 256x256 pixels), 3) For SVG files, simplify complex elements, 4) Choose appropriate background settings. Contact support if issues persist.

q1.question: What is an ICO file?
q1.answer: ICO is a file format for computer icons in Microsoft Windows. ICO files contain one or more small images at multiple sizes and color depths, allowing for proper scaling.

q2.question: What SVG features are supported?
q2.answer: Our converter supports most SVG features including paths, shapes, gradients, and text. Complex animations and interactive elements may not be preserved.

q3.question: Is my data secure?
q3.answer: Yes! All conversion happens in your browser. Your files never leave your device, ensuring complete privacy and security.

q4.question: What sizes should I choose?
q4.answer: For general use, we recommend the multi-size option (16x16, 32x32, 48x48) which covers most common applications and display scenarios.

q5.question: Can I convert SVG to Favicon?
q5.answer: Yes! Our SVG to ICO converter is perfect for creating favicons. Simply convert your SVG to ICO format and use it as your website's favicon.

q6.question: What's the difference between ICO and other image formats?
q6.answer: ICO files can contain multiple image sizes in one file, making them ideal for icons that need to display well at different scales. This is especially important for favicons and application icons.

overview.title: Overview
overview.content: This Privacy Policy describes how we collect, use, and protect your information when you use our Image to ICO converter service. We are committed to protecting your privacy and ensuring the security of your data.

dataCollection.title: Information We Collect
dataCollection.content: We collect minimal information to provide our service:
dataCollection.item1: Technical information such as browser type and device information for service optimization
dataCollection.item2: Usage statistics to improve our service (anonymized and aggregated)
dataCollection.item3: No personal files or converted images are stored on our servers

dataUsage.title: How We Use Your Information
dataUsage.content: All image processing happens directly in your browser. Your files never leave your device, ensuring complete privacy. We use collected information solely to improve our service and provide technical support.

dataSecurity.title: Data Security
dataSecurity.content: We implement industry-standard security measures to protect any information we collect. Since all conversion happens client-side, your files remain completely private and secure on your device.

thirdParty.title: Third-Party Services
thirdParty.content: We may use third-party analytics services to understand how our service is used. These services collect only anonymized, aggregated data and do not have access to your files or personal information.

userRights.title: Your Rights
userRights.content: You have the right to know what information we collect, request deletion of any data we may have, and opt-out of analytics tracking. Since we don't store personal files, most data remains entirely under your control.

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.content: If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy or our practices, please contact us at 0992sunshine@gmail.com. We will respond to your inquiries promptly.

acceptance.title: Acceptance of Terms
acceptance.content: By using our Image to ICO converter service, you agree to be bound by these Terms of Service. If you do not agree to these terms, please do not use our service.

serviceDescription.title: Service Description
serviceDescription.content: Our service provides online image to ICO conversion capabilities. The service includes:
serviceDescription.item1: Converting SVG, PNG, JPG, and other image formats to ICO format
serviceDescription.item2: Customizable output settings including size, quality, and background options
serviceDescription.item3: Client-side processing ensuring privacy and security of your files

userResponsibilities.title: User Responsibilities
userResponsibilities.content: When using our service, you agree to:
userResponsibilities.item1: Use the service only for lawful purposes and in accordance with these terms
userResponsibilities.item2: Not upload files that infringe on intellectual property rights of others
userResponsibilities.item3: Not attempt to reverse engineer, modify, or interfere with the service
userResponsibilities.item4: Take full responsibility for the content and legality of files you process

disclaimer.title: Disclaimer of Warranties
disclaimer.content: Our service is provided 'as is' without any warranties, express or implied. We do not guarantee that the service will be uninterrupted, error-free, or meet your specific requirements. You use the service at your own risk.

limitation.title: Limitation of Liability
limitation.content: To the maximum extent permitted by law, we shall not be liable for any indirect, incidental, special, or consequential damages arising from your use of the service. Our total liability shall not exceed the amount you paid for the service (which is zero for our free service).

intellectualProperty.title: Intellectual Property
intellectualProperty.content: You retain all rights to the files you upload and convert. We claim no ownership over your content. You are responsible for ensuring you have the right to use and convert any files you upload to our service.

serviceChanges.title: Service Modifications
serviceChanges.content: We reserve the right to modify, suspend, or discontinue the service at any time without notice. We may also update these terms periodically, and continued use of the service constitutes acceptance of any changes.

termination.title: Termination
termination.content: We may terminate or restrict your access to the service at any time for any reason, including violation of these terms. You may stop using the service at any time.

governingLaw.title: Governing Law
governingLaw.content: These terms are governed by and construed in accordance with applicable laws. Any disputes arising from these terms or your use of the service will be resolved through appropriate legal channels.

contact.title: Contact Information
contact.content: If you have any questions about these Terms of Service, please contact us at 0992sunshine@gmail.com. We will address your concerns promptly and professionally.

guidePage.title: SVG to ICO Guide
guidePage.subtitle: Complete Guide to SVG and ICO Conversion

definition.title: SVG Definition
definition.content: SVG (Scalable Vector Graphics) is an XML-based vector image format for two-dimensional graphics with support for interactivity and animation.

vector.title: Vector Graphics (SVG)
vector.content: Mathematical paths that scale infinitely without quality loss

raster.title: Raster Images (PNG, JPG)
raster.content: Pixel-based images that lose quality when scaled up

advantages.title: SVG Advantages
items: Small file size for simple graphics

formatIntro.title: ICO Format Introduction
formatIntro.content: ICO is a file format for computer icons in Microsoft Windows. It contains one or more small images at multiple sizes and color depths.

whyNeeded.title: Why ICO is Needed
items: Windows requires ICO for application icons
Multiple sizes in one file for different displays

fileStructure.title: ICO File Structure
fileStructure.directory: List of all images with size and color info
fileStructure.data: Actual image data for each size

items.title: Windows Applications
items.content: Windows requires ICO format for application icons and file associations

items.title: Web Browsers
items.content: Favicons must be in ICO format for proper browser recognition

items.title: Desktop Integration
items.content: Shortcuts and file icons need ICO for proper display

bestPractices.title: Best Practices
items: Use SVG source for highest quality conversion
Test icons at different sizes before finalizing

optimization.title: Optimization
optimization.content: Optimize file size while maintaining visual quality. Use appropriate compression for each size.

header.title: File Header
header.content: First 6 bytes contain file type and number of images

directory.title: Image Directory
directory.content: 16-byte entries for each image with size and offset info

data.title: Image Data
data.content: Actual bitmap or PNG data for each image

multiSize.title: Multi-Size Principle
multiSize.content: ICO files can contain multiple image sizes in a single file, allowing the system to choose the appropriate size for different display contexts.

items.title: High Quality
items.description: Best visual quality with minimal compression artifacts. Recommended for professional use.

items.title: Medium Quality
items.description: Balanced quality and file size. Good for general use.

items.title: Low Quality
items.description: Smaller file size with visible compression. Only for specific use cases.

items.title: System Tray
items.description: Small UI elements and notification icons

items.title: Transparent
items.description: Best for icons with irregular shapes. Allows background to show through.

items.title: White Background
items.description: Good for light-themed applications. Provides consistent appearance.

items.title: Black Background
items.description: Suitable for dark-themed applications. Ensures visibility.

tips.title: Quality Tips
items: Always use the highest quality source image
Test icons at all intended sizes
Optimize for file size without sacrificing quality

favicon.title: Website Favicons
favicon.description: Favicons are the small icons that appear in browser tabs, bookmarks, and address bars. They help users identify your website.

bestPractices.title: Best Practices
items: Ensure high contrast at small sizes

items.title: Windows Desktop Apps
items.description: Main application icon displayed in taskbar and desktop

items.title: File Type Icons
items.description: Icons associated with specific file types

items.title: Control Panel
items.description: Icons for system settings and utilities

items.title: iOS App Icons
items.description: App store and home screen icons

desktopShortcuts.title: Desktop Shortcuts
desktopShortcuts.description: ICO files are used for desktop shortcuts, allowing users to quickly access applications and files.

items.question: Why is my ICO file blurry?
items.answer: Ensure your source image has sufficient resolution. Use high-quality settings during conversion and include multiple sizes.

items.question: Why isn't transparency working?
items.answer: Check that your source image has transparency. Use PNG format with alpha channel and ensure background is set to transparent.

items.question: Why is the file size too large?
items.answer: Reduce the number of sizes included or use lower quality settings. Optimize your source image before conversion.

items.question: Why won't Windows recognize my ICO?
items.answer: Ensure the ICO file follows the correct format. Include standard sizes (16x16, 32x32, 48x48) and proper color depth.

items.title: Simplify Complex Designs
items.description: Reduce the number of colors and details for better performance at small sizes.

items.title: Use Appropriate Sizes
items.description: Include only the sizes you need. Common sizes are 16x16, 32x32, and 48x48.

items.title: Test Thoroughly
items.description: Test your icons in various contexts and sizes before finalizing.

items.question: Can I use SVG directly as a favicon?
items.answer: Some modern browsers support SVG favicons, but ICO is still the most compatible format for all browsers and platforms.

items.question: What's the maximum ICO file size?
items.answer: There's no strict limit, but for practical purposes, keep ICO files under 1MB for best performance.

items.question: Can I convert animated SVG to ICO?
items.answer: Standard ICO format doesn't support animation. Animated SVGs will be converted to static images.

items.question: How many sizes should I include?
items.answer: For general use, include 16x16, 32x32, and 48x48. For high-DPI displays, also include 256x256.

quickTips.title: Quick Tips
items: Use SVG source for best quality

needHelp.title: Need More Help?
needHelp.description: If you have more questions or need assistance, visit our main converter tool.
